newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrica Old Mutual, c.bank in talks on fund limits.
newsitem.headline: SAfrica Old Mutual, c.bank in talks on fund limits.

text.p: Old Mutual, South Africa's largest investment firm, said on Thursday it was in talks with the central Reserve Bank about raising to 20 percent the level of total assets that instititutions can invest abroad.
Institutions can currently place 10 percent of their assets offshore.
"We are applying to get that 10 percent limit on unit trusts lifted to 20 percent," Adrian Allardice, portfolio manager of Old Mutual Unit Trusts' industrial fund said.

He said it was more logical to allow investors to increase their international assets via unit trusts, South Africa's equivalent of mutual funds, than to increase the limit on individual foreign investment.
"(If you raise the individual investment limit) you are guaranteeing outflows of foreign exchange whereas our unit trusts do it through asset swaps," Allardice told reporters.
